data.title: C++11 and Godot
data.body: Is Godot tolerant to the C++11 standard? It seems Windows, Linux, Android, iOS, and Mac all support C++11 (at least the newer versions) so I was wondering if it was ok to write modules using it.

data.title: rename node not in place
data.body:
![screenshot from 2016-01-26 16-21-41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6195060/12583007/29754edc-c449-11e5-9ce6-18b008c69634.png)
as shown in the picture when I rename a scene that I've imported I find the renaming box misplaced.

data.title: small cosmetic change to joystick demo (handle joy_connection_changed)
data.body: Gives an example of using this signal by refreshing the label that shows the device name.

data.title: Keyboard input is redirected into script despite 3d view
data.body:
Sometimes when I'm opening new scene that have script in it's root node, the keyboard input is redirected into the script, despite the fact I'm seeing scene in 3d. To fix this I need to click on the scene to focus proper editor ui widget. As far as I noticed it's not happening every-time, but will always be the case if freshly opened 3d project have script in root node of main scene. 
Tested in e4cb104e6daa9c2e5781535ac8790f406ae53f08 commit
vid for quick judge: https://youtu.be/uhLJyc0wR0U 
sample (just in case): [WrongKeyboardInput.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/104798/WrongKeyboardInput.zip)

data.title: Android Export corrupts apk file
data.body: It seems after exporting an apk of the same game a few times in debug when you change export to release it corrupts the apk file. Here is the logcat of the parse https://gist.github.com/carlosmarti/3c2c75ec6ef44fd00b02

data.title: clear joystick state on disconnection
data.body:
Previously, the joystick helper methods (e.g `is_joy_button_pressed()`) returned out-dated values when called after the device has been (unexpectedly) disconnected, leading to undesired behaviour.

Well, one could connect on the `joy_connection_changed` signal and stop input polling if necessary, but we shouldn't expect this. And the joystick state should be clean anyway when there's no device.

data.title: Implements hotkey for toggling grid snapping
data.body:
Doing it this way is not optimal. The snap_point method handles checking
to snap rather than callers checking this before calling.

As a result I have to toggle the check before calling. I can't do the check
within the method because that means the method goes beyond its own
scope and would have visibility on input events. This would also break
anything calling which is again beyond the scope of this fix.

Fixes #3225

data.title: Add missing return for typeof() MethodInfo
data.body: This would add the missing typeof() entry in the @Global Scope documentation once doctool is run (I think).

data.title: Repeating buffer overflow in child nodes
data.body:
There seems to be an issue with the buffer size when adding a big amount of children to a Node.
For 256*256 nodes this causes the application to run unacceptibly slow.
I have posted some details in this thread: http://www.godotengine.org/topics/13772?r=13786

_Bugsquad edit: Error from the forum thread:_

```
ERROR: push_call: Condition ' (buffer_end+room_needed) >= buffer_size ' is true. returned: ERR_OUT_OF_MEMORY
At: core/message_queue.cpp:68
failed method: Sprite:_update_callback target ID: 54639
TOTAL BYTES: 1048560
NULL count: 0
CALL _update_callback: 43689
CALL _sort_children: 1#
```

data.title: The filename or extension is too long
data.body:
Using window 7 for compiling  scons platform=android target=relase

I changed the max_src 64 to 128 in the file drivers/SCsub still facing same error.

scons: **\* [drivers\libdrivers.android.opt.armv7.neon.a] The filename or extension is too long
scons: building terminated because of errors.

data.title: Slow response to touch input
data.body:
There is a problem with a response time to touch input. 
Here's a simple code:

```
func _input(event):
    if event.type == InputEvent.SCREEN_DRAG:
         set_pos(event.pos)
```

This script is attached to a sprite node. All it should do is simply place the node exactly where the touch event is happening, however there's a delay- when quickly moving finger across the screen it almost feel like there's this code happening:

```
set_pos(get_pos().linear_interpolate(event.pos, n*delta))
```

On tablet it is possible to get ~3-4cm distance between the positions of a finger and a sprite. 

I'll admit that the devices I'm using for testing are quite old: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 and LG Nexus 4, however I tested other demo performance made with Unity on same devices and I couldn't spot similar issue, that's why I think this is the engines issue.

data.title: can preload constants
data.body:
addresses #3234 as suggested by @reduz, although I could not figure out how to retrieve constants from autoload/singletons.
But at least class-level constants are supported now ^^

data.title: Fixed small inconsistencies with the text format
data.body:
Small fixes related to #2946.
- Removed .tres format from save dialog, when saving scenes.
- Main scene can be a .tscn file.

data.title: libevdev2:i386 is not installed on ubuntu by default
data.body: "error while loading shared libraries: libevdev.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory" when opening built game binary either on 32/64-bit ubuntu. 32-bit linux templates were built on ubuntu chroot with libevdev installed.

data.title: [Emscripten/Javascript] build compile error
data.body:
Using Visual Studio's 2013 Developer Command Prompt, I was trying to compile a HTML5 platform build to experiment the new features of the web export, but not so much as getting this error when trying to complie:

---

scons: **\* Multiple ways to build the same target were specified for: main.javascript.opt.debug.bc  (from ['main.cpp'] and from ['input_default.javascript.opt.debug.bc', 'main.javascript.opt.debug.bc', 'performance.javascript.opt.debug.bc'])

---

I was told on the Godot forums that it may be related to the Windows Case-Sensitivity, but what do I know. Hopefully this can get resolved so then I can try to export game projects to HTML5 format.

data.title: Change default video mode for X11
Removed debugger X (hide) button
Fix Output panel annoying focus steal
data.body:
Output panel was annoyingly stealing focus to the other bottom panels when a log was printed at game runtime.

Now it won't steal the focus if another bottom panel is already visible (in the above situation... it still steals focus once when run is pressed).

data.title: Fix .tscn not raising dependency error
data.body: Closes #3426.

data.title: Fix undo when merging actions
data.body:
The bug usually happens when dragging a spinbox in the Inspector dock, now when undo/redo, the property is set initial value when undo and the last value when redo.

Related to #3416.

data.title: Groups Editor: Clear LineEdit after creating a new group
Fix .tscn format not loading groups
data.body: Closes #3427.

data.title: Editor crash on sync scenes
data.body:
I insert one scene into other, and when update the scene I expect that it appears when running. But it not show! And when I change tables in Editor to see the inserted node the editor crash.
I was doing a video when it occurs.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BRRKzuGVTjw

data.title: Calling super method in subclass overrided methods
support gamepad remapping on android
data.body:
Also fixes #1839

I could only test this with one gamepad, as that's the only one recognized by my phone (ps4 pad, sony z2/android 5.1.1).
So some further testing would be appreciated.
I think it should be good to go if the following conditions are met:
- Works on Android < 4.0
- Actual sdl mappings work. Right now the only one we have is for the nvidia shield, so it would be cool if someone can check that thing.

APKs for testing (arm only):
[joystick-demo.apk.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/102170/joystick-demo.apk.zip)
[joystick-mapping.apk.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/102169/joystick-mapping.apk.zip)

data.title: .tscn format scenes do not load groups
data.body:
When opening `.tscn` scene files, groups are not applied to nodes.
The groups are saved in the `.tscn` file however.

```
[node name="Node2D" type="Node2D" groups=[ "my_group" ]]
```
